summary: This bill, the "Malheur Community Empowerment for the Owyhee Act," focuses on land management and wilderness preservation in Malheur County, Oregon. It establishes a grazing management program allowing for operational flexibility, designates wilderness areas, and provides for land conveyances to the Burns Paiute Tribe, including a co-stewardship area. The bill also establishes a Malheur C.E.O. Group to propose projects on federal and non-federal lands, with funding authorized for these initiatives.
